intro: Eritrichium kamelinii, commonly known as Kamelin's alpine forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to the high mountain regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue or purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments at high altitudes. It has small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in early spring, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, Eritrichium kamelinii is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
